nodes.text: These incredible edibles have made quite a comeback in recent years. Once shunned for being high in dietary cholesterol (one yolk contains about 60% of your daily allotment), eggs are now embraced as a healthy source of protein and nutrients like vitamin D.
cholesterol in our food has less of an impact on blood cholesterol than previously thought
"If, overall, you're choosing lean proteins and not eating a ton of fat and cholesterol, then eggs are a great thing to have in your diet," says Giovinazzo
The American Heart Association recommends that people with normal cholesterol limit their cholesterol intake to 300 milligrams per day.
